intro: Polygala forojulensis, commonly known as the Forojulensis milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Europe. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae, which includes around 750 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, often showy flowers that are typically arranged in spicate inflorescences. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species in its native range.
